Reviews.Title: “First stay here, would come back ...”
Reviews.Author: Frank_and_Barbara
Reviews.Content: Very nice location, close to Gendarmenmarkt. I arrived early and the room was not ready, but when I came back in the evening I got an upgrade. Nice room with a huge shower. Sleeping quality good, but the bathroom could be cleaner. Breakfast good, service nice and perfect. Check out took a little long,because not enough staff. I did not like that there was no space in the parking garage, they offered me parking 300 meters away.

Reviews.Title: “OVerbooked and non helpful”
Reviews.Author: Myra T
Reviews.Content: My coworker checked into this hotel after several hours of business meetings, very late in the evening, only to go into a room without a bed. He went back to the front desk and they offered him a free cab ride to another hotel. That was it. We booked this well in advance and it was left to him to try and find reasonable accommodations instead of sleeping on a couch.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: adisikd
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel based on it's prior reviews and location. The reviews were correct, this is a good hotel and it is in a quiet location! only (about) 200m from Under den Linden (near berliner dom) and it is close to many otehr sites. We almost didnt use transport, and if you need one you have a subway not far and a bus at the exit hotel and if you need the 100,200 lines (go through all the tourist sites) its only 200m away! The Stay was great, the hotel staff was very kind and helpful, always with a smile! Our deal included the breakfast buffet which was good, eggs and cheeses, good breads and ext. I will recommend it to friends and family. The only "bad" thing (not their fault) is we like hard matresses and bigger pillows... But after the long walks of berlin we slept like babies.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, ideal for city breaks”
Reviews.Author: bliksemschicht
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Breakfast was Slightly less, I missed some things, but the scrambled eggs with bacon made me forget that. Spacious room, clean, the bathroom is treacherous. There is such heating with red light and do the real light from outside. Good bus connection to the natural history museum. And also near the shopping Friedrichstr.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: vindesimone
Reviews.Content: Arcotel JohnF is surely a good solution if you are planning to have a holiday in Berlin. It's very close to Museuminsel and at about five minutes' walk from underground station of Französische Strasse in Friedrich Strasse. The hotel has very clean, quiet and nice rooms, with bathrooms where you can find anything you need, although they aren't very large. You can connect wireless to the internet without any additional charge. If you want to have your breakfast in the hotel, you'll have to add it to the fare. The continental is the cheapest between the two kinds of breakfast and offers an excellent choice for € 20. For a few days' holiday the hotel has the suitable selection of services. You can find a sauna and a fitness room, but it's small and with few machines. The staff is very attentive. For example, if you ask a room with a nice view, you will probably have one with the beautiful sight of Berliner Dom.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: olga065
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in March 2012. The hotel was a little out of the way for us. It was a good walk to some of the things we wanted to see. Had to take taxi. The staff were not the most attentive. The buffet breakfast was wonderful. The rooms were big but lacked character. The only thing we liked were the rocking chairs. We did have free internet which was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff, immaculately clean!”
Reviews.Author: 247JoanneB
Reviews.Content: 4-day break with my husband and 14 year old son. Delighted by the reception, helpfulness in recommending where to go, what to see, booked tour or Reichstag for us on arrival. We arrived early, room wasn't ready but we were given a complimentary upgrade - bath, shower, spotless, full sofa bed for son, tea & coffee facilities, free WiFi (fast). Ideal location for all the sights - in the heart of the Mitte district and very easy to get to public transport and the tourist buses. Gym/spa facilities simple and limited but more than adequate. Great view from the light, airy room. Breakfast varied, fresh & plentiful - didn't eat in the restaurant as lots to do elsewhere. Highly recommended - I haven't written a review here before but this prompted me to do so!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: voyager49_12
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was excellent and the staff were very helpful. The location was excellent - very close to Museum Island and Unter den Linden. Also easy to get to underground and bus stations. We ate in the Nicolai Viertel - about 10 minutes walk away- where there is a good range of restaurants serving huge quantities of typical German/Berlin food at good prices.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean but missing some details”
Reviews.Author: spiceylife
Reviews.Content: This is probably the cleanest hotel I have every stayed in! I stayed here on business in March 2012. The hotel is close to the Gendarmeplatz . the most beautiful square in Berlin and just a short walk from a great shopping street, Freidrichestrasse, and Checkpoint Charlie. The room was bright and clean and comfortable but lacked a few details. There were no coffee or tea making facilities in the room, no breakfast menu for having breakfast in your room, very few English language TV channels (just new channels). The staff were very friendly and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modern hotel but skip the food”
Reviews.Author: born2bwild
Reviews.Content: Love the rocking chair in the room. Without it, the room would be stark. The hotel is in a wonderful location. The staff is friendly, but seriously understaffed. We did have free internet access too, which was great. Skip the food.

Reviews.Title: “Pay a Little Extra for a Whole Lot More”
Reviews.Author: WeizenbierTreaclePud
Reviews.Content: Fab hotel. Easy to get to. High on chic low on arrogance. Seriously comfortable place for business and leisure travellers alike. The food is ok but hopelessly overpriced...the room service delivery charge is ridiculous but you can't complain when you have a rocking chair in your room. Yes the hotel IS a little pricey but ABSOLUTELY WORTH EVERY PENNY.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around and highly recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: Eli L
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ranked in the top 20 hotels in Berlin (out of nearly 700) and rightfully so. Excellent central location, helpful staff and one of the best rooms I ever had the pleasure to stay in. The value for money, considering it's a main european city, is outstanding! Would recommend this one without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Good service, nice rooms, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Ale-Milano64
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located a few minutes away from the Unter den Linden, the hotel looks new or recenlty refurbished. Service is warm and professional, rooms are not excessively big but comfortable (big shower, BTW, and really confortable mattress). Being inspired by JFK, you can find anywhere the famouse rocking chair. Wifi is free (you pay only if you need a lot of bandwith) and there connected PCs available. I had a nice stay and I think price was the right one. Will return there if I'm back in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel procedures come first”
Reviews.Author: HuntlyHampshire
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the wonderful Gendarmenmarkt and is ideally situated to visit the Berliner Dom catherdral, TV Tower, Frederick Strasse shopping centre. It is about 15 minutes from the Reichstag, the Brandenburg Gates and the Memorial to the Holocaust. We booked a Junior suite for three nights and we were a little disappointed when we got to our room. It was very small for a suite and only provided one easy chair! However, it was spotlessly clean and the bed was comfortable. The room we had (525) was initially quiet - as we had requested - however, at 1.30am we were awakened by very loud noises. Someone was moving furniture around and this lasted for around 2 hours. We thought it must be the guest in the room above us. The following night we were awakened at 1.30am again. This time by a machine - sounded like a floor polisher - my husband rang down to reception to ask what was going on. We were told that they had arranged night cleaners to come in and clean the wellness centre above us!!! We were actually quite shocked by this. After all we had requested a quiet room, and above all things needed a good night's sleep. We changed rooms the next day to 425 which was an improvement. The hotel handled our complaint very efficiently, and apologised by delivering some macaroons to our room. However, this was a much needed break for us and it was spoiled. I question why the management felt the need to employ cleaners who use machines and move furniture at that time of night. What are they thinking about - obviously their procedures come before guest needs. We ate at the restaurant on the first night after having some dreadful cocktails in the bar. I had a warm, syrupy cosmopolitan which was truly dreadful. We were the only guests in the restaurant!! However, we did have a wonderful bottle of Merlot and the food was actually quite good. Our waiter seemed delighted to have some guests and was very efficient. It seems a shame that the hotel do not promote the restaurant better. No-one asked us on check in if they could make a booking for us and there was no sample menu in the room - I think they are losing revenue by not doing this.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: murfs1
Reviews.Content: It is a modern hotel in an excellent location, but would be ideal, well for us,if the floors were a little more welcoming, no pictures or colour,coffee & tea making facilities in the room, better pillows,duvets,storage and at least one more english channel on the TV also the shower could have been designed better, firstly a bigger shower screen and with out the pop up and down plug as you will find yourself either stubbing your toe on it or constantly stepping on it,also no bath robes or slippers the reason we are highlighting all of these is that we have stayed in lower star hotels than this one and got all of the above! we can not fault the breakfast as it very good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect sleep and fantastic mattress”
Reviews.Author: travelgay
Reviews.Content: Loved the quality of the bed, very comfortable mattress (hard). Paid 70 euros with their special winter rates, nothing can beat that as all other hotels around were charging 90 euros. Very happy with our choice. Main clientele is average of 45 - 50 years old and business crowd. Only point is that the immediate area gets very quiet after 18h00.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: zoewheeler1979
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked this for my Christmas present and we stayed for 3 nights. I really couldn't fault the hotel. The location was great, close to major attractions and u bahn. Staff were friendly and helpful, the bar was especially nice before heading out for the night. The rooms were a good size and comfortable. The shower was huge! Overall we had an excellent stay and would certainly return next time we visit Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: londonbelgian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Arcotel in Berlin for a city break. From the moment we arrived until we left the hotel staff stood out and were exceptional. They couldn't do more for us. I would particularly like to thank tobias for his excellent efforts in making our stay worthwhile. The breakfast is outstanding, very healthy and provides a choice of continental, cooked or you can specially order something else, like porridge. The hotel is very convenient for all the attractions in Berlin and within easy walking distance of many nice restaurants including a good vegetarian 'chipps'. We would most definitely stay there again, a fantastic four star with a chilled out bar and welcoming atmosphere. I would very much recommended this hotel and the staff should compliment themselves on excellent customer service.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel worth its price”
Reviews.Author: aszanti
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in vicinity of Frierichstrasse - one of main shopping attractions of Berlin. Other POI are also close. Check-in was swift, the room light, modern and clean. A bar and a restaurant, but most probably you do not come to Berlin to eat at the hotel! Breakfast offers good choice and there is enough room to contain the guests even at peak hours. They also have a nice gym and fitness (sauna) located at the top floor. Not the best of the world but the hotel offers good value for money and is really worth recommending.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Surfer R
Reviews.Content: We stayed there last December for 3 nights. Location is great, rooms are clean and comfortable the staff efficient and helpful. Did not try the restaurant but the lobby bar is very god either for a drink or a bite (they have some delicious sandwiches and burgers), and quite popular in the evenings. The young lady from the bar(sorry for not knowing her name) was especially nice and patient with us.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: febravo
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, ideally located, walking distance to most of the attractions and also very close to the underground. Staff were friendly and helpful, business centre had internet and printing was possible and easy. The free (wi-fi) was slow though, and you had to pay for higher speed connection, so that was slightly disappointing as we picked this hotel for the free connection (it did work well, mind). The room was a bit small for the price, but immaculate and tastefully furnished, and the shower was enormous. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Suzo888
Reviews.Content: We spent our first 2 nights in Europe in this hotel. It was perfect for us. Very spacious room and bathroom. Great breakfast served up each morning. Was right across the road from one of the Christmas Markets. Staff were very helpful. Bed was comfortable. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel best location”
Reviews.Author: tbeeri
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend in this hotel (16th-19th December). The location of the hotel is great, walking distance from most of the attractions, the staff is friendly and the room was very nice. We will come back. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: David G
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a weekend (9th to 12th December) in this hotel and have no hesitation in recommending it. Rooms are clean and have plenty of space, shower is superb, food good but most of all the staff are excellent and go out of their way to be of help. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Nadia050
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for visiting the Christmas markets, helpful staff and the accommodation is clean, comfortable and of a high standard. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location and great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TheLittlePea
Reviews.Content: Cannot believe the quality and location of this hotel considering the room rates. At around £100 a night I expected a nice hotel but this exceeded my expectations. Wonderful rooms, in terms of size and decor. The location was a big reason for staying in this hotel, a short walk to the Under den Linden and Museum Island or a pleasant (15 min walk) to Alexanderplatz. Staying in this hotel anytime of the year would be a pleasure, we went for the Christmas Markets and found that one was a few steps from the entrance. Love Berlin, love this hotel and love the christmas markets.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for Berlin”
Reviews.Author: BlueLan
Reviews.Content: I was in Berlin for business in early Nov, and had a great stay at the John F Arcotel. The hotel has a good location -- in a quiet place next to a German government building, but only a short walk away from many interesting sites. I liked the rocking chair in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Great and Central Place!”
Reviews.Author: DonaTita
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so well located central and close to all the sites to be visited. My husband and I stayed for three nights. Great welcoming staff, wonderfully sized rooms for european standard, spotless. The breakfast buffet is fantastic although expensive and the breakfast place around the corner (Chipps) is a wonderful place for breakfast and lunches! The bathroom is great although we did not have a walk in shower but a tub with a shower possibility. Two comments: the duvets were small and short so it was hard to cuddle or to even just envelop yourself in their warmth! and something typical of most hotels: the make up mirror is fundamental now a days, but obviously the person who installs them does not need one or they are very tall, because they are too high and too far away from your face! (this is not the first hotel I have seen this happen!)

Reviews.Title: “BIG plus.”
Reviews.Author: gnewey
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic for museums and sightseeing, but not smacked in the middle of nightlife, which is great for blissful sleep. The hotel is well designed (although the two giant rocking chairs in my room are kind of clumsy), clean, nicely maintained. Another plus, FREE wifi. The staff is SUPER, very friendly, professional and helpful. Downside, go hungry after 11pm, no food in hotel or surrounding (except for the room mini bar snacks), and the room phone, I needed a manual to call the front desk. Overall a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “CENTRAL FOR SITESEEING”
Reviews.Author: JHSGloucestershire
Reviews.Content: Have just returned froma 4 day break in Berlin, I could not fault this hotel, friendly staff, comfortable rooms, nothing seemed too much trouble. Very central walking distance of shops and most of the attractions. It is worth taking the on /off bus tour. There is a charming Bistro on the corner and a very nice restaurants a little further away.

Reviews.Title: “Great all round hotel, funky, stylish and great location”
Reviews.Author: andytudor46
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and we received a warm welcome, we got room 124 and it came with a courtyard view. The view was fab, a beautifull view of the court yard and had the sun in the morning :-). The room was very clean, modern and stylish and the beds were really comfy and the bathroom was fab too, very modern. The room had a flat screen tv, mini bar, snacks and if you needed a ironing board you could always ring down for one which we did and they are quick to bring it up too. We went to the bar for a few cocktails a couple of nights and the cocktails were fab, I could have stayed there all night but the drinks were a bit pricey but it was great, the girl behind the bar was so friendly. The location of the hotel is within reach of everything I couldn't fault the location, loved the German markets across the road :-) the tube was really close by too so we could get around the city really quickly. I would defo recommend this hotel to anyone, very modern, stylish with a great location, next time I come back to Berlin I will defo rebooking. Love it.....

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: bdahye
Reviews.Content: Is a nice modern looking hotel with friendly staff who speak english and are helpful. The rooms are clean and there is free wifi. My complaints are that there are no tea / coffee making facilities (you have to order room service), you cannot purchase any tv / movies and there is no teletext (subtitles in english). They do however provide you with a DVD player. The pillows are like loose sacks of fluff...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in a very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RitchieO
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. Thought thee hotel was wonderful. The hotel is very modern and has a good mix of tourists and business guests. The breakfast was terrific, the staff friendly and helpful and it was in a good location. It is verY close to some very good restaurants. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants nice hotel with a friendly staff and a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Do not miss it when you go to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ratchev
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel with great location, nice and friendly stuff, cousy and comfortable rooms. Do not miss it when you go next time to Berlin...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: raffenator
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with everything you want from a weekend-getaway-hotel: a comfy bed, big shower, nice bathroom, mini bar (which even features a making-love set and a piece of Berlin's wall), v good AC, and more. I would say the only main drawback is no breakfast included in price which makes this hotel a tiny bit more expensive than I anticipated, but then again overall I don't think I overpaid. I can definitely recommend it, whether for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “The icing on the cake”
Reviews.Author: chrismCambridgeshire
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night stay at the Arcotel John F on the occasion of my 60th birthday. From the time we arrived, we were struck by the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. The bedroom was a reasonable size and comfortable, although perhaps a little minimalist in decor. The hotel is well situated with most of the historic sites within walking distance. We didn't eat in the hotel and so cannot comment on the food; however we did go to a couple of very good restaurants, with hearty German food, in the St Nicholas quarter, about 15 minutes walk away. I would have given the hotel a '4' rating, but the fact that, unprompted, they presented me with a birthday cake pushes it up to a '5'!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: susane07
Reviews.Content: Arcotel John F is a great hotel. It had JFK rocking chairs in every room and the lobby (nice touch - I assume it was a copy of President Kennedy's White House rocking chair). It is in a great location for major sites in Berlin; it is well managed; hotel staff was superb; it was very clean and quiet. I did not take advantage of the breakfast or wellness centers (limited time). I had room service one night and it was excellent. The shower and plumbing were fantastic. There was free wifi. This hotel, while located in a great place to access historic sites, is located in a nonresidential neighborhood. So we visited nearby neighborhood to access grocery stores, etc.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: vered_10
Reviews.Content: just came back from 4 nights at the arcotel jhon f. along with another couple we all thoght this hotel deserve the best score in any relevent aspect: mostly location, but also beauty stylish and well equiped rooms. whice were perfectly and most efficently designed for the benefit of all guests. service was warm personal and most kind both at the reception and at room service cleaning services and lounge waiters. breakfast was served in a beautifull breakfast room and was most tasty fresh varide and stylishly served. lounge served beautifully and tasty small dishes which were real gorme stacy at the reception gave the best recomendations most of which we tried and enjoyed . Bravo stacy! the hot choclate at the gendermanmarkt chocolatery was realy the best we ever tried. can't wait to came back again. the four of us promised each other we will . and we will defenately come to the same hotel. the perfect adress in Mitte area. if that is the district you want or need to be , that this hotel is the most perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Camila A
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, right in the center of Mitte and walking distance from the main turistic attractions in Berlin. The rooms are big and very clean. Free wifi was available in my room, although I don't think it is in every room. The decor is great! The staff is kind, but I didn't have any special requests...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in East Berlin, but don't bank on getting a drink!”
Reviews.Author: Viscount57
Reviews.Content: We spent five days in Berlin, combining a business conference for him with sightseeing for her! The hotel is situated just far enough from the major tourist sites to be quiet and relaxed, but near enough to walk to some of them, and close enough to all forms of public transport to make access trivial. Check in was very efficient, and we were given a large, airy room. The shower is huge and the quality of the fittings is very high, as are the usual consumables. The bed is very large, comfortable and the linen crisp. The only unusual feature, and this is very much a matter of personal style and choice , is the oversize headboard in buttoned silver, Lighting and wardrobe space are excellent as well. Room service is prompt, the quality better than average and the price , for a hotel, reasonable. Breakfast is a delight, with as much choice as anyone might want, although it can become a little chaotic at times when tour groups are rushing to set out for the day. My one real criticism is the bar. It is extremely well furnished and comfortable, but the policy seem to be to leave one poor girl to cope with large groups and at one point we couldn’t get served for 25 minutes despite being leant on the bar itself! This is strange as the staffing in terms of numbers and quality is otherwise excellent. There are dozens of excellent restaurants within ten or fifteen minutes walk, catering for every pocket and taste. The nearest major site to vsist is the Cathedral, which is about three minutes walk away, but the TV tower, Alexandrplatz and many more can be reached very easily on foot. Overall, this hotel represents excellent value for money in class, a great location and wonderful staff, just don’t bank on getting a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Efficiency and style”
Reviews.Author: kontiki-T60
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the John F for a recent work conference. Rooms were comfortable and styling interesting even if there were a few quirks like the kitchenette facility within the room. Food was good, bar and public area service excellent. Conference facilities v good. Staff helpful and efficient. Gym small but good equipment. TV was adequate but not exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: petercole107
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 1-4 October 2011 for my 40th Birthday. Location excellent in the Mitte district with all main sites nearby. Easily accesible by public transport from airport. Firstly all the staff both on reception and in the bar/restaurant were all so helpful and friendly/courteous. The rooms were equipped to a high standard. The breakfast buffet was excellent with wide variety of choice to suit most people. I was also surprised as on the day of my birthday when we got back to our room in the afternoon a birthday cake had been left with a greeting card from reception. This was totally unprompted and a really nice touch. I have been waitng to go to Berlin for years and the choice of hotel made the trip even more enjoyable. i cannot rate the hotel highly enough and would definitely stay again and would recommend this to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MaedchenJFK
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel! Good location--Clean rooms--Good food--Free WiiFii! Staff at front desk are very helpful and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luba N
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for two nights during the Berlin marathon. Excellent location, very close to the Brandenburg Gate where the marathon starts and finishes. Rooms are spacious and have large windows. The view from my room was unforgettable: a small church right in front of me, the Berlin Cathedral and TV Tower in the distance. Very good bar and restaraunt downstairs. Extremely helpful staff! Altogether, most pleased with my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Faith N
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the Berlin Marathon and wanted a hotel close to the race start/finish, that was of very good quality and would not kill our budget. This hotel fit on all counts. Only 1.6 km (ish) to the start of the race (near the Brandenburg Gate) and easy access to all other sites and shopping in 'Mitte'. Our room was spacious and the hotel facilities were very good (though we did not try the fitness centre this time around). Finally, the price was quite reasonable for a hotel of this quality and in this location on the marathon weekend. If you are driving, just be aware there is no place off the street to unload - just pull up at the front door for check-in. Also, it might be best to let the hotel know that you are driving and that you would like a spot in their garage if possible. We did not but were still lucky to get the last spot (and they did park for us). There is however, a public parking garage nearby. We did not have breakfast included in our package and opted on a couple mornings for the continental breakfast in the bar area. It was not fancy but the food and coffee were very good. Also the price was much better than the full breakfast in the main dining room. Just to note that this was the second 'Arcotel' we have stayed in and the other was good too. If you are looking for good hotel while in Germany or Austria, give might want to give an Arcotel a try.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Topcat63
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at the end of September, weather was lovely and we were able to walk everywhere. Check-in was smooth and all staff speak excellent english. Rooms are clean,modern and spacious, the free apples are a nice touch. Free toiletries are excellent quality and a massive walk-in shower is lovely. Breakfst in the restaurant is a little chaotic, waitresses seem rushed and unorganised, perhaps someone directing guests to tables would help, All said choice of food was excellent and all fresh. Bar is lovely, relaxing and friendly with very knowledgable staff, good cocktails, and I loved the Berliner Weisse with Woodruff Syrup or Raspberry, so refreshing. Alexander Platz within 15 minutes walk, checkpoint Charlie, 25 minute walk, the Topograph of Terrors is well worth a visit. Sachsenhausen Concentration Camp is a must, free entry and get the S1 U-Bahn from Frederichstrasse, 40 minutes ride, last stop on the line, €3 each way, and then a 20 minute walk to the camp, well worth it. Can recommend the Bistro near Hotel, turn left and walk to corner of Genermarkt, about 7 minutes walk, cheap food & drink and very friendly. Berlin is a lovely city and the people very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: jasstir
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in a superior room overlooking the park. Could not fault the hotel, it was welcoming, check in easy and friendly, rooms modern, bathrooms clean and fresh. Good location and easy to walk to all attractions. Staff all spoke english and this was a godsend when I unfortunately had to be taken to hospital at 3am - Yvonne arranged an ambulance and even translated for us. We even received a call from Nancy (reception) the following day to see if I was o.k and to say that if we needed anything just to ask. Will be coming back to Berlin and will definitely be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in top city.”
Reviews.Author: mg788
Reviews.Content: Berlin is a 'must visit' city for lovers of architecture and archeology, and this hotel is ideally placed within walking distance of the Unter dem Linden, the Pergamon Museum, Alexanderplatz, and so much more. Comfortable rooms, helpful staff and good facilities complete the picture.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Relaxing Atmosphere, Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: cjs0601
Reviews.Content: This hotel is warm and inviting the second you walk in while still maintaining a high-class ambiance with its artistic touches. The staff was welcoming and helpful. The hotel is only a short 5 minute walk to Museum Island and the Sunday market which is great for souvenirs. It’s also a very short walk to the shopping and restaurant areas. When we asked for a cab to the airport, one arrived in less than 2 minutes. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable and the shades keep out all of the light for sleeping late but open up the huge window for some natural sunlight and a great view of the city. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You, Arcotel John F!”
Reviews.Author: Fabysuzy
Reviews.Content: WE ARE SO HAPPY AND WILL BE BACK! That's the first thing we want to say in this review...:-) We read many good reviews on the hotel, and oh they are all so true! From us, the hotel scores full marks for staff and services, cleanliness, comfort and location. The ladies and gentlemen at the front desk could not be more helpful, and they treated us with a smile. Whenever we needed something or had a question, it was acknowledged and done quickly. Never did we need to make a second call (because the staff listen and remember, that's so important). And yes, they all speak perfect English! The hotel itself is modern and clean. It is located in a quiet residential/government offices area, which is safe and a perfect place to go back to after a busy day exploring the city. U-Bahn is just 3mins walk away, so you can easily reach all destinations which are not at your door-step already (ie. Museum Island, Gendarmenmarkt, Unter den Linden, Friedrichstrasse). There are many good restaurants within walking distance (from causal to Micheline Star) , if you want to try something else than the hotel's own. Our room was big and bright, and everything we needed were at hand (very impressed at how clean and calcaire-free the coffee pot was, and the bathroom was just spic n' span). Air-cond, TV, DVD Player, Cordless Phone and Mini-Fridge all worked well, and the fresh apples in the room kept the doctor away! Did not have a chance to use the sauna and gym, but peeked inside and they looked decent and clean. Little improvement could be made, if there are more shelves/drawers for placing sweaters and scarves. Bed was top-quality, but the pillows were a little flimsy for my liking. Last but not least, we came back late on a Sunday (also my birthday), and found courtesy from the Chef, a lovely Strawberry Birthday Cake and from the Assistant Front Office Manager, a Birthday Greeting Card in our room. What a nice surprise it was! We have travelled during our birthdays many times (even staying in 5-Stars hotels), and this is the first time we got a cake from a hotel. That little gesture really touched our hearts! Berlin is an exceptional city and we would like to visit again. When we do, there is no doubt we will book our favourite hotel, Arcotel John F, again!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: vaskoItaly
Reviews.Content: Very good business hotel in Berlin. The room was ok. Close to a lot of Berlin attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: starryLondon
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a perfect location. A few minutes' walk from the museums and a busy street with restaurants, stores, etc. Free WiFi which was a decent speed for a hotel. Clean rooms with funky designs. Restaurant a bit expensive. Staff are friendly and helpful. Felt safe as a solo female traveller. Room service was speedy. Room had a large safe which easily accommodated my laptop, etc. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, great location, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: gertnap
Reviews.Content: Nice modern hotel, great location near unter den linden, ubahn and museuminsel. We did not have breakfast in this hotel, but in café dresssler on unter den linden. We also did not use the restaurant or bar in the hotel. Plenty good restaurants on walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: star03
Reviews.Content: The Arcotel is new, with modern decor, including small and nice gym and sauna complex accesable free for all guests. Room price includes full and filling buffet breakfast. The Hotel is located in a business area, but less than 500 meters from the museum island, less than 300 meters from the Untre the Linden main street where the main bus lines (e.g. 100 and 200) run and less than 300 meters from a U station. The staff were very friendly efficient and helpfull. What more can you expect from a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: Rekh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little gem! Location is perfect, just 2 mins walk to the tube stop. Beautiful view, comfy beds, would stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Arcotel John F Hotel was an excellent choice.”
Reviews.Author: ari111
Reviews.Content: They serviced us with smile and even let us take umbrellas when needed... The room is standard size and comfortable. It's in the middle of the mitte in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a long weekend away”
Reviews.Author: DJWinter
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a well located and reasonably priced Berlin hotel with decent facilities and the Arcotel John F fitted the bill perfectly. First, the location is excellent - it's a short walk into the heart of Mitte, which has a fantastic selection of bars, restaurants and other amenities, including the museum district. Mitte is a fascinating area to explore; it has a greater proportion of quirky and artistic shops and galleries and has a very friendly atmosphere. There are also U-Bahn stations within walking distance of the hotel that can take you across the city. The hotel itself suited our needs perfectly. It's very stylish and modern with all the facilities that you would need during a short city break. The breakfast selection was excellent and was available for a longer duration than you would typically expect. There was a well provisioned bar in the lobby area with a good sized seating area. We were even able to hire bikes directly from the hotel. I don't think they have many available, but we were able to hire 4 for the day, which was very convenient. The rooms were fine for a short stay - no coffee or tea making facilities in the room, but this was a minor point. The beds were large and comfortable and the bathroom was very well equipped. Finally, I have to say that the staff were some of the most helpful and friendly that I've ever come across in a hotel. The porter, reception and bar staff provided fantastic customer service and made us feel incredibly welcome throughout our stay. Overall, a fantastic stay in an ideally located and comfortable hotel - very highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vilmarie A
Reviews.Content: Staff super friendly and location right in the heart of town. Room very clean and super nice. Will definetely stay there agian!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: AshinAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Kudos to this hotel! We booked ahere at the last minute in desperation after a disastrous stay in another hotel (part of a gift) for the first night of our Berlin visit. When we arrived at reception, looking battered, bedraggled and sorry for ourselves at 9 am, ready to leave our bags in their storage and explore Berlin, they took pity on us and not only let us check in early, but also upgraded our room a class. The rooms themselves are very 'design hotel' - clean clear lines, lots of light and everything is fluidly sophisticated. Our room had a sofa and a rocking chair, in addition to the bed as well as the desk area with plugs etc/LAN connection all framed by a huge picture window with a view of the church. The rocking chair is great - you can imagine John F or indeed Bill C in this chair getting up to no good! The minibar is reasonably priced and includes things like a sightseeing kit (cool compress eye mask) a condom set (this is Berlin!), chocolates etc. The minibar fridge is also big enough to put your own things in it as well if you like. The bathroom is well appointed with miniatures as well as soap dispensers for those who prefer to be green and don't like the minis. There are a couple of apples in the room as a welcome gift with the tea and coffee tray, which was very welcome. The bed itself is very big, and in usual German style is two singles beside each other each with their own bedding. I know lots of people find this odd, but I have to say my partner and I both sleep better in German beds than in our own bed - no fighting over the covers! TV has mostly German channels with BBC and CNN, but there is a DVD player and you can check out DVDs from the reception library free of charge. I was ill on our last night and we did this and it was great! Didn't check out the fitness centre or spa, or the library with it's computer terminals, but we would have done if we had been there longer. We also didn't use the restaurant. Behind the church in front of the hotel you can see the Museumsinsel. If you exit the hotel and turn left within two hundred metres you are at Gendarmermarkt. If you turn right and walk along the Franzoichestrasse you will eventually come to the Nikolaikirche and the Alexanderplatz. If you walk straight on alongside the church you will come to Unter den Linden and eventually to the Brandenburg Gate. You can see the Museumsinsel from the hotel. Behind the hotel is a U-bahn stop and a restaurant, Chipps, where we had a great breakfast. Just at the back of the hotel near the U-bahn there's a tabac where you can get English language papers. You can rent bikes at the hotel or at the tabac. The location of this hotel is perfect for pretty much everything and you'll have a great experience of Berlin using the John F as a base. We liked this hotel very much, but were especially appreciative of the welcome we received from the ladies on the front desk when we arrived in the morning after our disastrous experience at the other hotel. They were so nice that they literally made me cry! I had been convinced that our Berlin experience would be a nasty one after our first night and they helped persuade me otherwise. Thank you! If you are hesitating about booking, don't - JUST DO IT!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Jens-Birgitte
Reviews.Content: Extremely friendly and helpful staff. Great location in the center of Berlin. Very nice breakfast buffet (maybe a little expensive). Excellent rooms (the best we have ever tried!). DVD-player with the possibility of borrowing movies in the reception. Fantastic bathrooms, small cooking area and a refrigerator. The only downside is the high prices for the rooms :(

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mitchoLondon
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel! Modern, clean, spotless and in such a great location. Near the Berliner Dom and loads of great places to see and eat. Thoroughly recommend. The staff were also fantastic, so helpful and could not have done enough for you. When I go back to Berlin I would stay here again (and I will go back to Berlin as its a fantastic city).

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly and very Central”
Reviews.Author: kouli
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is located very close to the Central (friedrichstrasse) where all the shops are located and close to the Nikolaiviertel which is the old city. Directly n Front of the Hotel is a Bus station which transfers you to the Central Train stain station and the Ceter in order to go from there whereever you want. I would highly reccomend the property as the staff is very friendly and helpfull with all our questions. The rooms are spacious and very quite.The Value for Money factor is deffintly present. I would deffinitly choose it again for a stay

Reviews.Title: “A good choice...”
Reviews.Author: frenchcomposer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for 9 nights as a combination of conference and personal holiday. The hotel was chosen for its proximity to the conference venue and also for the fact that it was close to many of Berlin's city centre attractions. We were made to feel most welcome at all times - and our limited knowledge of the language was never a problem with any of the staff. Our room was very spacious and always spotlessly maintained. We loved the huge shower - with its very non-slip tiling. Toiletries are supplied. Should we have needed it, I believe that any reasonable Internet access would not have been charged for, though there were 4 free computer terminals in the lobby area also. We had the Continental breakfast every morning - at 7.50 Euros it was the least expensive option, and was more than adequate. It included fruit juice, coffee, fresh rolls , cheese and cold meats, and croissants. A bus went right past the front door, and went to one of the main train stations, though a daily bus ticket at 6.80 Euros would connect you to many areas of the city using other bus connections. We were only a short walking distance from the routes of the Open Top buses that do the usual round trips. There is a fitness centre - though we did not use it. We would stay there again should the need arise.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, except the design...”
Reviews.Author: XLhehe
Reviews.Content: Great facilities, bedding, super clean etc... Just a big NO for the design : silver plastic & black oversized furnitures. An esthet nightmare, but looks like it is the trend these days...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good position.”
Reviews.Author: nekeyah
Reviews.Content: This must be one of the best hotels we have stayed in. Gave us an upgrade, and room was fabulous. All staff went out of their way to be pleasant and seemed to genuinely love what they were doing. Food was excellent at reasonable prices. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Earns the 4 Stars”
Reviews.Author: ATBN
Reviews.Content: Good location in the new center. The amenities and the size of the room, as well as the new strucutre and decorations were on par with the pricing and the stars. The service, as mentioned by others could be warmer and leaves something to be desired in this regard. All in all a good choice in Berlin in that price level.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin chic and stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: dianayjose
Reviews.Content: If you have a very short period of time to visit Berlin, then this chic fashionable hotel in Berlin Mitte is the right place to stay. Just a step away from Unter den Linden, the Berliner Dom, Museums Insel, Gendarmenmarkt , Friedrich Strasse, AlexanderPlatz and the Nikolai Viertel. We stayed for two nights in a double comfort room, the room is stylishly decorated, comfortable ,spacious, good bathroom, friendly staff and an ecxellent breakfast buffet. Good choice of restaurants and bars around the area of Gendarmenmarkt, and nice shops in the Friedrich strasse. Museums Insel just across the street if you're interested in Museums and art, don't miss the Pergamon Museum, amazing!! Good, high speed internet acces for free. We'll gladly be back our next time in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location for museum island”
Reviews.Author: Mark_Of_Loxley
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in July 2010, but only just got around to writing this review. The room assigned was on the 3rd floor at the front so had a great view. The bed was fantastic. Just as shown in the hotel photo. Hotel facilities are very good and considering how cramped Berlin rooms usually are, then the room sizes are more than adequate. The museum island is just about 5 minutes walk away, though it is a bit of a trek from the subway point, though the tourist / main bus stops are outside the hotel, so if you get a travel card you have plenty of options.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Our_Thoughts_Sydney
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Berlin as part of our honeymoon. Because of this fact the hotel gave us a complementary upgrade and some lovely treats. This was a really lovely gesture. To add to this the room was excellent, the location terrific and the staff were extremely helpful in providing assistance particularly regarding Berlin related activities.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable modern hotel with nice bar”
Reviews.Author: AmandaOZ09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Arcotel for two nights and found it very comfortable and everything one would expect from a four star hotel. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom very modern. It was a bit dark as we looked directly into another building but I imagine there are nicer rooms. It was only about ten minutes walk to Checkpoint Charlie and cafes and restaurants and all the shops also so the location was good. We didn't eat in the restaurant due to the cost but found plenty of cafes nearby. The bar was very comfortable (drinks being the usual hotel bar prices) with the trademark rocking chairs to relax in, which makes it a memorable hotel for me. Also the four free internet points were very usefull. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Breakfast Pastries”
Reviews.Author: BennyMalaga
Reviews.Content: I chose the Arcotel John F because I wanted a location near Museum Island. When I reached the hotel I found out that it took only 5 minutes to walk to Museum Island. Our room in the hotel was spacious and there was a rocking chair, probably to remember JFK. . People working in the hotel were friendly. What we enjoyed most was the breakfast buffet. The pastries such as the muffins and brownies were really very delicious. We met the chef, whose name was Marian, and complimented him on his baking skills. I will always remember those wonderful muffins and brownies.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & friendly”
Reviews.Author: roybaby
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed sightseeing in Berlin staying 5 days at the John F Hotel, just off Unter den Linden. The hotel is very comfortable and well located in a nice district. Public transport is close at hand. The staff are extremely helpful and pleasant. We enjoyed our breakfasts in it's modern airy restaurant. The waiting staff very efficient & pleasant and the choice of food fine. The room was well furnished and had a nice bathroom. The hotel was in an ideal place for sightseeing and the area local to the hotel is great for early evening stroll & had plenty of good restaurants. One minute stroll from the hotel & you are on the Unter den Linden and can stroll up it's length to the Brandenburg Gate or walk to the Berliner Dom.

Reviews.Title: “Superior”
Reviews.Author: Patt-Khalili
Reviews.Content: This hotel was superior to most German hotels, in so much that it added exceptional courtesy and friendliness to its list of amenities. This hotel bent over backwards to please its geusts; and it also provided nominal services, like guides, tour ticket purchasing, pertinent advice of various types and genres, and other sundry services that made my stay absolutely perfect. This is a place where luxury meets sincere courtesy, which made it even more pleasent to come back in the evening. Thier rooms are luxurious, yet also comfortable; but the people and the service made it all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for exploring the sites”
Reviews.Author: lovelucia
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for one night during the easter weekend. We were very impressed; staff were very polite, the rooms were very clean and well-designed and the location was absolutely brilliant. We did a walking tour (Insider Tours - highly reccommended!) and all of the main sights were within comfortable walking distance of the hotel. Also a good choice of restaurants, bars within 15 minutes walk, and plenty of public transport to explore other areas of Berlin. Would definately stay at this hotel again if we returned to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cheekywelshmonkey
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, good sized quality rooms, pleasant and friendly staff. I stayed there during April, when Nato had their sumitt next door - all the streets were closed off for Hilary Clinton. Ive stayed in at least 6 other hotels in Berlin Raddison Blu, Intercontinental, Park Inn, Ramada and this is my favourite.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mayacamp
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the good reviews it got on TripAdvisor. Perfect location, close to all the sight in Berlin, restaurants were just minutes away. The staff was very nice, spoke very good English, it was quiet, clean. My only complaint is the shower, wasn't the best, the bathroom got all wet every someone took a shower, but that's a minor complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and priced Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mandrontour
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a short break rooms very nice and within 10 mins walking distances of all the major sights of Berlin. Can particularley recommend the cafe/bistro behind the hotel for breakfasts ( Chipps was the name). Large beds very comfortable. I will certainley stay here again. Staff were extremley helpful booking us tickets to the TV tower saving us 2 hours of queing.

Reviews.Title: “Like city like hotel”
Reviews.Author: EstebanBelgrado
Reviews.Content: This was my second hotel from Arcotel chain. I could say that both hotel were nice example of good service and good accommodation. John F has interior that goes with a city of Berlin. It's modern, but comfortable. With many nice details but nothing is over the top. Reception guys were absolutely fantastic. Very helpful but not "too pleasant" or with fake smiles which I don't like. They gave us free upgrade which was nice gesture, so we got very nice superior room on a 6th floor. My only remark is that I would expect a little bit bigger room if it's superior, but I can't complain since I got it for free. Maybe I would be a little bit disappointed with size if I would pay higher rate. One more thing - fitness room should have a little bit more equipment. Sauna and steam room were very nice and always empty. Location is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: SteveEast1965
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights in the middle of feburary. It was a nice trip to Berlin. Very friendly and outgoing staff. It was one of the best Hotels at our europe trip. We enjoyed the beautiful surrounding area. Also recommendable is a drink in the TOWN Bar. Very nice people - a great city and a perfect hotel = a good holiday feeling

Reviews.Title: “BEST CHRISTMAS PRESENT EVER!”
Reviews.Author: patsy55_10
Reviews.Content: I decided to take my husband to Berlin on a city break for his Christmas present and chose to stay in the John F. the reveiws were good and the location seemed excellent. We were not disappointed. Such a great location. The hotel was well furnished and the bed was so good, i cannot remember ever sleeping so well, even in my own bed! We forgot to take our" do not disturb" sign down in our rush to get out, so when we returned late afternoon we realised our room had not been touched. This was our own fault so we said nothing. We went out for dinner and when we got back to our room, it had been made up. We did not think anyone saw us leave the hotel, but they must of checked and then did our room. This was a pleasant suprise! The breakfast was included in my booking and we had read that some people thought it expensive. We do not know the cost, but it was superb. Fresh, hot and a great choice and really set us up for the day. One thing i did like, instead of all of this horrible piped music, we had bird song. sounds a bit mad, but it was so relaxing whilst eating breakfast. We intend to return to Berlin in December and will definately be going back to the John F.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: PinoyDutch
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the rates on offer and the many positive reviews it has received. We were not disappointed. The room was very comfortable with a touch of understated luxury. The bed was easily the best we have experienced in a long time. We also liked the bathroom: we prefer a good shower, like the one on offer, over a bath. Finally, the room had a dedicated fridge (separate from the mini-bar) which was a nice touch. The only odd thing about the room was a rather useless kitchenette: a stove top, but no microwave, pots or pans, cooking utensils, cutlery or crockery. This space would be more useful as additional wardrobe space: the existing wardrobe was smallish for a 4-night stay for two people. Our rate included breakfast. This was a good choice because breakfast was plentiful, very good quality and good value-for-money. Due to the location of the hotel there are no obvious "outside" breakfast options in the immediate vicinity. Hotel staff were efficient and friendly. The location of the hotel is more or less in an office area, next door to the foreign office buildings. This does mean that the immediate surroundings of the hotel are very quiet (some people might say "dead") after hours and in the weekend. However, public transport connections are good (bus stop in front, U-bahn only 5 minutes away). Also, the hotel is within walking distance of the Museum Island, Unter den Linden and Friedrichstrasse (all within 10 minutes). This proved to be extremely convenient. All-in-all we had an excellent stay and have no problems recommending this hotel. One note: it would appear there is going to be a lot of construction in the area in coming years (U-bahn, City Palace reconstruction, etc). To avoid any noise try to get a room overlooking the courtyard rather than the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a brilliant location.”
Reviews.Author: k8mcg0811
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. Good sized, very clean room. Super location, near to lots of attractions. Lovely sauna and steam room. Brilliant nights sleep in a very quiet room. Only slight criticism is that there are two small duvets to fit the bed rather than one big one. Very nice shower. Good internet with printer at the back of the bar. Not much more to say except it was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful introduction to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: NIrelandrosie
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotel experiences we have had in a long time. The staff are so friendly & helpful - nothing is too much trouble & is all dealt with quickly. The rooms are fab, so different from run of the mill standard hotel decor - the rocking chair is a great idea. It is so central, as it was so cold & snowy we did use the metro alot but in warmer weather would prefer to just walk everywhere. So many major sites within walking distance of hotel - Brandenburg Gate, museums, checkpoint charlie etc. Have to also comment on the towels - the softest we've had yet in a hotel!! Would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, with lovely rooms in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Fell-O_TravellerUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in December having from a large conference hotel in Berlin and what a difference it was to come here. The staff were absolutely great in both english and german, and the rooms felt as if there had been some thought into them, which is hard for a reasonably large hotel, but it didnt feel like a bog standard room - nice decoration around the bed and a lovely rocking chair!! The location is generall fantastic being in the old East Berlin area near the gorgeous Gendarmenmarkt (best Christmas market is here). You can get to most of the main sites within a 20 minute walk. Th only slight downside was that there isnt a tube stop within about 5 minutes walk which was fine for us but may not be ideal. However this does mean it is on a quiter street so you should hear any noise at all. Breakfast was lovely with a great choice of things. The main advertised rate seemed expensive but you can quite easily get a good deal rate of the room and for the money is a excellent.

Reviews.Title: “excellent comfortable hotel in Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: helenawesome
Reviews.Content: we are just back from a 3 night stay in berlin where we stayed at this hotel. firstly the location was excellent with the airport shuttle train from Schonfeld airport travelling to alexanderplatz and a ten min walk from there. taxis available nearby if the walk is too much. location and room very quiet and the hotel was a short walk away from the berlin tower and cathedral. the room itself was modern and nicely furnished and was very clean and well equipped. there was free ( slow ) internet access for first 24 hours on arrival but there are pc points in the lobby for all guests.. it had a really nice bar where you could have a nice relaxing drink. there was a restaurant but we did not use it so cant comment. the metro is very accessible with all the attractions on the ring route. but we walked alot of the places and can recommend this city to anyone for a definitely must visit place.. the staff on the reception were very helpful in all aspects and very efficient. I could not fault them in any way. this was our first time to stay in the arcotel chain of hotels but we will definitely be looking at them on our next city visit. this hotel clicks all the boxes. we would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: EBUman
Reviews.Content: The price of this hotel through lastminute was very reasonable and it is near all amenities including some very nice German restaurants within 5 minute walk. Rooms were nicely decorated with some nice touches and the reception staff were extremely helpful. Couldn't fault.

Reviews.Title: “great room, location, service and staff”
Reviews.Author: jmandak
Reviews.Content: we took one of the corner rooms surrounded with windows and it had a very modern floating bed/ desk design...very comfortable and nice, clean , great shower and bath are, very bright the breakfast that you can have at the bar was fine for us...meats, cheeses, pastries, breads and tea or coffee for 6 euros was great, very professional staff and when we arrived at 8AM from the US, they did not have a room because they were full and there are only 4 of our room types but they tried to get it ready early and they called our cell phone to let us know at about 12:30 so we could have a nap! the location is very central and we walked everywhere from there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hig186605
Reviews.Content: Clean & modern & close to all the sites & metro - so yes a veru good hotel..... but....if I was to go back I would probrably stay a little further out from the center, as the city is so spread out that each day / night we were takling the metro anyway so could have easily stayed further out.....as it is in the cneter but everything from restaurants/bars are all awya from the center.

Reviews.Title: “Not serious”
Reviews.Author: Garbosan
Reviews.Content: We made and paid a reservation (lastminute.com) 2 months in advance for 1 night in Berlin.When we arrived, they told us at the front desk that our reservation was cancelled and they had decided to made us a reservation in other hotel (not as good located as this one). Not a message was recived from them neither from lastminute.com. Next stay in Berlin, we surely choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - staff are polite but distant. V good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: CITYGIRL024
Reviews.Content: I don't think that this deserves 4* status. Good location, rooms are clean but sparse i.e. not cosy or comfortable. Staff are polite but distant and I definitely would not recommend the restaurant for evening meals. Nice and quiet for business travellers and families.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: jdc20016
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and it is in a great location to explore Berlin. It is one block south of Unter den Linden and just two blocks from Museum Island. The staff are efficient, friendly and helpful. We don't speak German, but they all spoke excellent English and made us feel welcome and comfortable. The room was comfortable and clean. The buffet breakfast (included in our rate) was extensive and tasty. Free access to the internet in the business center off the lobby was a plus. It is a relatively new hotel and not very busy when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in a stunning hotel in the nicest part of Berin”
Reviews.Author: jennarothen
Reviews.Content: We arrived a few hours before check in but our room was already prepared. The lifts are only useable if you have a room key. This made us feel very safe as soon we got there. Its only 5 miles from Tegal airport and cost around 20 euros in taxi. We were greeted by friendly staff and our room was extremely clean. The only negative about the room was that two beds were put together to form a big bed which was a little awkward. The beds were very comfy though. The view from our room was very nice. We were situated on 4th floor and could see Friedrichwerdische Kirche ( church) It is a 5 minute walk from Under Den Linden which is where most bus routes are and a 15-20 minute walk to Brandenburger Tor. The area is currently undergoing some work but you do not get disturbed by any of this. There was a big flatscreen tv but mosly german channels, but there is a dvd player. If you bring something to watch yourself it is great. Breakfast was also great, with a buffet style theme, from sausage, bacon, eggs and ham. It caters for all needs. The later you go own the busier it gets. The bar is open for drinks and bar snacks aswell as having an in room menu. The restaurant is also open except for Sundays. As others have said the prices do seem expensive however everywhere you eat in berlin it is expensive. 10 euros for a burger at most restaurants. It is situated in a quiet part of berlin but many places to eat around the hotel and close to many tourist attractions. Once checking out you can leave your bags while you go out sight-seeing. They also arranged for a taxi to take us back to the airport. We didn't have to arrange anything except pay the taxi. If eating out i would recommend Andy's bar and dinner which did some excellent food. The hotel is also on a bus route 147. You can purchase day ticket for 6.10 euros and get on and off as many buses that day in are A and B. The best bus route are 100 and 200 which take you to most attractions. This is on Unter Den Linden. It is also a few minutes from U-bahn but we used the buses.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel in what I believe is the nicest part of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: TLocantro
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a fairly short stay in Berlin to cater for the Pearl Jam concert and were focussed on a more modern hotel. The Arcotel John F exceeded our expectations on a number of fronts. Firstly the negative aspects included, no iron/board in the room (however these can be requested through reception). My best advice would be to seek an iron and board during check in if required. Now normally German engineering is so meticulous it is ridiculous, however the shower without a screen and design threw water all over the bathroom when it hits the occupant in the shower. Just ensure you put plenty of towels down before embarking inside. Other than that the shower is superb! The room is ultra modern, ultra clean and has a small kitchenette although there are no pots and pans in the room. There is a small food store down the road for your supplies (leave via the side exit for easy access) and it is of the gourmet variety. Flat screen TV's are great, the bed super comfortable and the whole "vibe" of the room matches the city. The rooms offer temperature control which I feel is paramount to enjoying your stay. I loved the carpet which had the names of tourist destinations and was again in earthy tones and suited the hotel and city perfectly. Now where this hotel really excells is if you walk out the main entrance and head left, I believe you are in the nicest part of Berlin, with the dining options in the main areas, wide streets, beautiful earthy tones and funky shops in the immediate vicinity. You also are very close to Lafayette and the U barn is a very easy walk. The hotel was extremely well priced, with a decent bar that provided screens for our viewing of various world cup games. Breakfast options are available and are fairly priced. The staff were helpful, very well presented and professional in all dealings with them. Those with internet withdrawls would be pleased to note that there are four workstations near the main bar area and access is free for hotel patrons. That area is used for conventions and seminars so at times there could be some traffic, but I never experienced any issues with getting a computer. I intend to stay at this hotel on my return to this wonderful city, and in fact I believe it was staying at this hotel and getting used to its location that enhanced my view in the first place. Very, very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and modern design hotel with a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: argh80
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for work and chose it because of its location and (at the time) cheap price. Room was quite spacious and had interesting layout - sink, mirror and desk behind your bed, seperate walk-in shower. Comfortable bed, firm mattress. On the downside my room wasn't properly cleaned and while the minibar had lots of fancy and "different" stuff (Wasabi peas, condoms, sleeping mask, playing cards) simple things like a kettle were missing. Breakfast was simple but of high quality, the artificial bird singing might not be everybody's cup of tea. Staff at reception was very helpful. The location of the hotel is quiet and right next to the Auswärtige Amt so the area can get quite deserted after working hours. However a 10 minute walk will take you straight to Gendarmenmarkt where you will find lots of (mostly expensive) restaurants and bars. So in general I would recommend this place if you get a decent deal and/or need to work in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great & safe location!”
Reviews.Author: ETeeSD
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only 2 blocks from Hausvogteiplatz station! The staff are helpful & friendly! The hotel is quite posh. It is located in a walking distance (to me) to many tourist attractions (such as Reichstag, Unter den Linden, Potsdamer, Brandenburger Tor, Holocaust Memorial) but in a quiet neighborhood! The gym has not much to show for. It only consists of a few cardio equipments with neither any free weights nor weight machines. There is a bus stop right across from the hotel where you can catch a bus to Heuptbahnof (main train station).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room in the centre of berlin”
Reviews.Author: Leylandbros
Reviews.Content: On arrival, we upgraded to room in order to get a bathroom with a bathtub. It was a great move. We ended up with a surprisingly large and beautifully decorated room with good views. We also received a late checkout - this allowed us to have 4 extra hours in Berlin. This hotel is very central to many of the tourist sites - within walking distance. There is also several underground train stops nearby. Breakfast was OK . However, I found it better to walk down to the Gendarmenmarkt and find one of the many restaurants there to have breakfast. The Hotel staff were very helpful and polite. A wonderful, relaxing stay at the John F - I will definately stay here again on y next trip to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & service”
Reviews.Author: foacinitaky
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brilliantly located to access Berlin's museums and attractions, and handy to the underground as well. The staff were all welcoming and most helpful in sorting out a problem with a travel agent. They were very responsive to any requests we had and left us with a very warm feeling. Rooms were spotless, conducive to excellent sleep, and the bar and restaurant service could not be faulted.

Reviews.Title: “As expected, so why don't I want to return?”
Reviews.Author: WalkersWA
Reviews.Content: The hotel was as advised by other TA reviewers - modern, clean, good facilities, good bed, excellent location. So why do I feel negative about this place? Is it because one of the front desk staff wasn't interested in talking to me? Or was it because if you say that you only want the continental breakfast, you're quickly sent packing out of the restaurant, back to the crowded bar area? Or no shampoo or hand soap? Or just a general feeling that this place doesn't really welcome guests? Not sure, but think that I'll try elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Modern Hotel, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: dannysherwood
Reviews.Content: Really friendly staff make staying here great from check in to check out. They couldnt do enough for you, even taking a tour bus ticket to one side for us for a member of the group who was delayed and popping it into their room for them. Cool interiors, really smart funky rocking chairs, very comfy bed and nice touches like an apple a day per person per room! Really close to the Museum island (just over the road) and about 5 minutes walk from Alexanderplatz so ideal for everything you want to do. Walk down the road for 10-15 mintues at youre at the Brandenburg Gate too, great bars and cafes and restaurants all within a 10-15 walk too - its ideal and really good value. Only downside was pretty steep bar drinks, 3x G&Ts and a beer cost €32, which is London pricing in a great hotel but not quite what this ought to have been. But not too much of a worry, it will just teach me to be on time and not early meeting people!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great value”
Reviews.Author: cynthia2005
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights and found the hotel staff helpful, the hotel well located and the room clean and large. The area the hotel was in was quiet and very close to all the sites in the East of Berlin. Near to Unter den Linden and the museums and good restaurants in the Gendarmarket. The room was much larger than expected and the bathroom and big shower particularly nice. The service was ok and the free wi-fi throughout was a bonus. Would defintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay at the Arcotel JFK”
Reviews.Author: travel_soldier
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on a sightseeing trip to Berlin for my girlfriend's birthday. There are some really great things about this hotel. The rooms are spacious and beautifully quiet. The hotel is in a great location - very central but very tranquil. The U-bahn is a two minute walk around the corner while the s-bahn and a nice shopping street is a ten minute stroll. All the staff were very polite, helpful and efficient. There is also a sauna and steam room on the top floor along with a small gym with nice running machines and exercise equipment if you feel inclined. On the downside breakfast (not included) was too expensive. There is a nice bakery in the square with the U-bahn where you can get a nice pastry, juice or coffee for two people for €5. The lobby of the hotel was very nice but the common areas around the rooms look rather utilitarian. The carpet in the halls and the room we had felt more 2* Ibis than 4 star! Lastly I loathe rooms where you get a double bed consisting of two matresses - not conducive to a romantic weekend! In conclusion then - a good, comfortable hotel but no real "wow" factor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sambucada
Reviews.Content: Really liked the location and the overall atmosphere of the hotel. The room was good with an excellent shower.Really liked the small kitchenette with a decent sized fridge.When a kettle and dressing gowns were requested they were delivered straight away. We weren't that fond of the carpet,and they were a bit stingy with the tea bags. Overall a great place to stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: Delius17
Reviews.Content: Smart, comfortable and chic. Quiet, and local to many of the main sights. Would definitely recommend. (The only niggle was the restaurant prices in the evening seemed to be very expensive, but that seemed to be the case all over Berlin. Lunchtime specials were much more reasonable.)

Reviews.Title: “Quiet enough”
Reviews.Author: OregonianOregon
Reviews.Content: Quiet – not much noise from outside and not bad interior noise. Yet this is right in the Mitte, very near Pergamon Museum. Allegedly hotel was overly booked so my room was turned into a smoking room and upgraded. Not at all smoky after I left windows wide open all afternoon in 0 Celsius weather. (Was it really full? There is a light outside each room showing whether or not the key is being used to keep lights on. Rarely were more than a few of these lit on Friday-Sunday, a bit more by Monday night.) Size was OK for one, possibly OK for two, in the upgraded and so perhaps larger room. Stupid LARGE rocking chair others have commented on: might have been a bigger problem in a smaller room, taking up space. My problem was that it was terribly uncomfortable, only someone exceedingly tall could have found it usable. Free internet is fine for email, not good for Skype or surfing. I paid the €19 for 24 hours usage, not a bad deal. Priced OK through hotels.com, higher price through hotel itself. Would I go back? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cocodot
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and loved our stay at the Arcotel John F. Great rooms - clean, enough space, modern - and friendly, helpful staff Also great location and within walking distance to most sights. Would definitely recommend. Breakfast was good although a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: valynadine
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good situated - near the "Berliner Dom", "Unter den Linden" and the "Alexanderplatz". The rooms are new and very clean. We enjoyed the design and the quality of the furniture. The breakfast was nice. The prices are really ok for the location, the service and the quality.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: marcinelle
Reviews.Content: The Arcotel John F of Berlin is situated right in downtown, ive minutes walk form Unter den Linden in a very quiet street. The Hausvogteil U-Bahn station ij just behind. From and to the airport, tka the TXL bus, in front of the Staatsoper. Tjhe rooms are clean, confortable and well furnished. The breakfast is very good, erved in a pleasant room. Furthermore, the staff is very courtesous and efficient. The prices are exactly what you have to expect for such a for stars hotel in Berlin. A very good addresse for a pleasant stay in a wonderfull city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little hotel, perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: fishbone96
Reviews.Content: This lovely little hotel is perfectly located for the leisure traveler. It is within walking distance of Museum Island, Alexander Platz, Unter den Linden, Opern Platz, The German History Museum, shopping, and so much more. There is a U-Bahn station 1-1/2 blocks away. Free WiFi is available. We appreciated the lower-cost continental breakfast option (and I must say that the coffee was excellent). The room was clean, quiet, and comfortable. The staff were very helpful and attentive.
