One change I would make, however, would be to offer a wider variety of food available in the bar in the evening for those who just want a small plate and a drink. Thank you for a great stay. (P.S. We left some clothes in the room which the hotel is forwarding to us at our expense. I appreciate the fact that the clothing didn't go missing forever.)

Reviews.Title: “Spanking new hotel with friendly staff. And rocking chairs.”
Reviews.Author: Kisapuisto
Reviews.Content: Wonderful modern hotel not far from Unter der Linden and Alexanderplatz. Calm and safe location next door to Foreign ministry. Impeccably clean rooms, friendly staff and good U-Bahn connections. Absolutely great for the price. And I loved the theme of JFK rocking chairs everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel of my trip”
Reviews.Author: WorksOnly2Travel
Reviews.Content: My partner booked this hotel for our 5 night stay in Berlin. He managed to get a good deal as the hotel had only just opened when he booked our room. The service of the staff was excellent - they were very helpful. The hotel is in a good location - It was about 25 euros from the Teigel airport to the hotel. It was a short walk from the hotel to the Berliner Dom, and the French Cathedrals (opposite the French Catherdrals is a really cool souvenier shop selling different and original type keepsakes). It wasn't too far a walk to Freidrickstrasse or Unter Den Linden. There was a MRT station about a block away, which was handy to use to get to Potsdammer Platz etc. Behind the hotel is a healthfood/convenience shop which was handy to pop in and get a sandwich or icecream. The rooms were amazing - Huge and spotless. I loved the bed and the plush pillows. There was a great bench under teh TV which had a led that opened so I could sit and do my makeup. There was free, fast internet. Reception provided us with the access code each day. The bathroom was great - The shower fantastic (It was huge!). I was a bit perplexed by the red UV light that you could switch on - I wasn't sure what it was for... Our room had a small kitchenette - a sink, hotplate, kettle and best of all, a empty bar fridge! After drinking barely cold drinks throughout our trip (as many European shops didn't seem to keep their drinks as cold as they do here in Australia) we were delighted to have a fridge which we, ourselves, stocked with a few bottles of water, Coke and wine! There was a lovely looking bar and restuarant on the ground floor, but we didn't try them out. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Newly built Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SissiGreece
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location with easy access to every major attraction in Berlin, chic neighbourhood, very quiet street, beautiful view, near to bus station, U-Bahn and museums. The room was comfortable & clean and the bathroom was spacious (we had a specially adapted bathroom for people with disabilities). Also, they provided us with a small kettle for tea/coffee which was great. The check-in was very fast and the hotel staff informed us of every feature of our room. The hotel's business corner with free PC use and fast internet was a plus. Unfortunately, we didn’t try the breakfast as we found that 18euros per person was expensive. However we were informed that there was another type of breakfast less expensive (with limited choices of course). What is more, the receptionist did not know the transportation system well and gave us wrong information. On the other hand, when I lost a personal item during my stay in Arcotel John F, the receptionist promised to send it to my house if it was found. Which she did! Now, this is what I call great service. And these little things make you feel like an important guest. To sum up, I can’t wait to visit Berlin again and of course stay in Arcotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great on all counts”
Reviews.Author: Palominoamv
Reviews.Content: Great on all counts...comfort, service, location...

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, been in better been in worse”
Reviews.Author: gjwkdy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at the end of june. Hotel is in an ok area with a 5 minute walk to the nearest u bahn and maybe a 10 to 15 minute walk to alexanderplatz. Our room had a huge walk in shower rather than a bath but I don't think all the rooms have this. It also had a small kitchen area with 2 cooker rings and a fridge ( which I switched off as you could hear it all night ) The room itself was very clean and had LCD TV and also a DVD player which was a nice touch, you can borrow dvds from reception but nothing very recent. The only negative points I can add are the door did not double lock which you might not think is a problem but on our first night in the hotel the reception checked in a late arrival ( 23:30 ) to our already occupied room. I think he got the biggest fright as he was the only person in the room with clothes on. All in this is a decent hotel but I prefer the Park Inn Alexanderplatz where I have stayed several times before

Reviews.Title: “Bland business hotel masquerading as a boutique establishment -”
Reviews.Author: dtitlow
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the JF for a business trip only to be told that they had overbooked the hotel and i was being moved to sister hotel in berlin for one night - I would rather have been warned of this before I left London - the hotel I was moved to didnt have free internet access in all rooms so I had to argue with the front desk to get comp access as I would have done if I had been in my original hotel - also there seemed to be little or no communication between the hotels as reagrds my situation until I kicked up a fuss - There were many apologies but little else offered - I thought they might have allowed me a complimentary breakfast during my stay instead of charging the staggering amount of 18 euros! The room was adequate but nothing special and the furnishings are very plasticky and cheap - the black leather sofas are particularly mean and offensive - maybe if a little less had been spent on the daft JFK rocking chairs and a bit more on improving the tiny rather feeble showers in the old peoples home style bathrooms I would have been happier - I also expect that there is slightly more atmosphere on the moon's surface than the desolate bar next to the lobby - next time I will stay in a youth hostel!

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel in East Berlin”
Reviews.Author: reddobie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Arcotel John F in Mitte...what a great location! Near Gendarmenmarkt, Museum Island, Unter den Linden, Riechstag, and Brandenburg Gate, and Freidrichstrasse...also just a few subway stops from other areas...also, hotel is located on a quiet street...plenty of restaurants, and cafes, shops.. Our room: was very cool...grey/black kind of urban/art decco looking...the beds are really comfortable...there is no dresser to put clothes in, which we have found to be the same in other Berlin hotels, also one suggestion would be to have a clock in the room, with a lighted LCD display...the flat screen TV is nice...nice mirror on TV table...bathroom is great, great towels, good shower...and nice toiletries...good blowdryer/makeup mirror...room is smallish, but very stylish, and very clean...the maid staff does an outstanding job... The bar: had to mention it because the two wonderful bartenders there make the best cosmos ever!..The bartenders were very sweet and professional... There is also a gym area with great elliptical and treadmills, sauna, steam room... Breakfast was included with our room price..the tea was great...it has a nice assortment of choices, and great vitamin juice... Two things I want to mention about this hotel that really stand out, when comparing other hotels in Berlin, we stayed at the Pullman Schweizerhof in West Berlin in March, for example...is the free internet access, if this is important to you, you will love this added bonus...It is free in the room, which we didn't bring laptops, so can't comment about it, but they also have 4 free computer terminals with a printer for hotel guests to use, which I thought was so great, as many other hotels charge fees for internet access...and second, their phone charges are not crazy to the US...no hidden expensive charges at the end of your stay...I gave family members the hotel phone and they could dial direct to our room for whatever cost you usually pay to Germany...and I was able to phone family to say to call me back, the cost was .90 euro...for about a minute or so... Outstanding new hotel...will definitely be competitive with comparable hotels... if location, internet, and a cool room are what you want, then this is a great choice...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: vanillaface
Reviews.Content: Located near Unter den Linden and Museum Island, one couldn't ask for a better location. Our room was small, but clean and comfortable and the staff was helpful and courteous. Also always appreciate free internet access. The restaurant is very good and reasonable except for breakfast, which we found to be good, but expensive. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel : nice furnitures”
Reviews.Author: PhilippeMonleau
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotel : the room is very quiet, there is a lot of light with the big window,the bed is very comfortable,the furnitures are very funny and the bathroom very efficient. The bad side is a cold atmosphere in the hotel and AC did not work so we had to sleep with the window open to cool the room. The cleaning of the room was not very serious and carpet has not been vacuumed in three days. The location is really great and you face the Berliner Dome when you go outside.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, very helful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Sr1992
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights on a weekend break to Berlin, and paid a rate of 89euros per night. It was excellent, the room was clean, and very well apointed with Free (Slow) internet, tea and coffie making facilities, minibar, even a bathrobe on request. The hotel was very new (open 1 month) so is very clean and tidy. The room was also very quiet. The staff were also extremely helpful very willing to assist with anything big or small. I can highly recomend this hotel.
